intro: Hieracium xatardianum, commonly known as the Xatardian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and features showy yellow or orange composite flowers. The plant typically has basal and alternate leaves that are rough and hairy, with a serrated edge. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
